title: 112_hr5381
content: The Act is titled the "Commonsense Legislative Exceptional Events Reforms Act of 2012" and includes amendments to the Exceptional Event provision of the Clean Air Act. The "Commonsense Legislative Exceptional Events Reforms Act of 2012" amends the Clean Air Act by adding criteria for exceptional event demonstrations to minimize the Administrator's discretion in approving or disapproving them. The Administrator will develop criteria for exceptional event demonstrations in conjunction with input from the States, reflecting varying technical expertise and resources. The approval process may be expedited or streamlined, considering conditions for suitable exceptional event demonstrations. Timing of approval or disapproval will be specified in the Clean Air Act. Section 319(b)(3) of the Clean Air Act is amended to include a deadline of 90 days for the Administrator to approve, disapprove, or request additional information for exceptional event demonstrations submitted by States. If no action is taken within the 90-day period, the demonstration is considered approved. The Clean Air Act is amended to include a 90-day deadline for the Administrator to approve or disapprove exceptional event demonstrations submitted by States. If no action is taken within this period, the demonstration is considered approved. The Clean Air Act is amended to include a 90-day deadline for the Administrator to approve or disapprove exceptional event demonstrations submitted by States. The burden of proof for approval or disapproval is based on a preponderance of the evidence, with substantial deference to State findings. Appeals process is also outlined. The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency must revise regulations under section 319(b) of the Clean Air Act within 180 days of the Act's enactment.
